attributes.action: Hold officials in public office accountable for misleading or lying to citizens
attributes.additional_details: To provide more transparency and honesty in the public domain and leveraging greater trust in leadership and governance functions of this country
attributes.background: Introduce an independent review board with sufficient power to suspend an official in public office  including MPs, Cabinet members and civil servant for acts demonstrably evidencing attempts to mislead or lie to the public.

rejection.details:
We understand that you public officials and elected representatives to beheld accountable for being dishonest, but it's not clear what you want the Government or Parliament to do to achieve this.

Civil servants are already subject to the Civil Service Code, of which honesty is one of the core values. The Civil Service Commission can investigate complaints about breaches of the code.

MPs are subject to the House of Commons Code of Conduct, of which honesty is one of the general principles of conduct. The Committee on Standards and the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards can investigate complaints about breaches of the Code of Conduct.

Ministers are subject to the Ministerial Code, which requires the principle of honesty to be honoured at all times. Investigations into breaches of the Ministerial Code are a matter for the Prime Minister.

If you want these arrangements to be changed, you could start a petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do to achieve this.
